rComments: Awesome class. Learned about films, concepts, and practices I've never heard before and came away with a fresh understanding of ethnofiction and poetic realism. There was no textbook, and Rini provided all the readings for free online, a poor student's dream come true.
I really liked this class. A little heavy on the theory, but it's for a reason. I feel it only enhanced my projects. Rini is super nice and always helpful.

Rini Keagy's class, Found Footage 171C, is a shameful excuse for a class in the Production portion in the Film and Digital Media major at UC Santa Cruz. For a production class, it is highly theory-based and most classes are spent in a discussion of the week's reading. Do not take this class.

For a production class, there was very little production.  All of class time is spent either going over the readings or watching films.  Not once did we get to work on our projects during class (which is in a lab) so the only way to get input before it's due is to go to her office hours.  READING IS A MUST... I wouldn't recommend her.
